019package org.jgrapes.util;
020
021import java.util.Arrays;
022import java.util.Collection;
023import java.util.Collections;
024import java.util.LinkedList;
025import java.util.Map;
026import java.util.Objects;
027import java.util.Optional;
028import java.util.Set;
029import java.util.function.Function;
030import java.util.stream.Collectors;
031import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;
032import org.jgrapes.core.Component;
033import org.jgrapes.core.ComponentFactory;
034import org.jgrapes.core.Components;
035import org.jgrapes.core.Event;
036import org.jgrapes.core.Manager;
037import org.jgrapes.core.annotation.Handler;
038import org.jgrapes.util.events.ConfigurationUpdate;
039
040/**
041 * Provides child components dynamically using {@link ComponentFactory}s.
042 * 
043 * An instance is configured with a collection of {@link ComponentFactory}s
044 * and component configurations. For each configuration where the
045 * referenced factory exists, a component is created and attached to
046 * this component provider as child.
047 * 
048 * The component configurations can be updated by
049 * {@link ConfigurationUpdate} events.
050 * 
051 * @since 1.3
052 */
053@SuppressWarnings("PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis")
054public class ComponentProvider extends Component {
055
056    private String componentsEntry = "components";
057    private Map<String, ComponentFactory> factoryByType;
058    private Collection<Map<String, String>> currentConfig
059        = Collections.emptyList();
060    private Collection<Map<String, String>> pinnedConfigurations
061        = Collections.emptyList();
062
063    /**
064     * Creates a new component with its channel set to this object. 
065     */
066    public ComponentProvider() {
067        this(Channel.SELF);
068    }
069
070    /**
071     * Creates a new component with its channel set to the given 
072     * channel. 
073     *
074     * @param componentChannel the channel that the component's
075     * handlers listen on by default and that 
076     * {@link Manager#fire(Event, Channel...)} sends the event to
077     */
078    public ComponentProvider(Channel componentChannel) {
079        super(componentChannel);
080    }
081
082    /**
083     * Sets the name of the entry in a {@link ConfigurationUpdate} event,
084     * that hold s the information about the components to be provided.
085     * Defaults to "components".
086     *
087     * @param name the name of the entry
088     * @return the component provider for easy chaining
089     */
090    public ComponentProvider setComponentsEntry(String name) {
091        this.componentsEntry = name;
092        return this;
093    }
094
095    /**
096     * Sets the factories that this provider knows about. Only
097     * configurations with a component type that matches one
098     * of the factories are handled by this provider.
099     *
100     * @param factories the factories
101     * @return the component provider for easy chaining
102     */
103    public ComponentProvider setFactories(ComponentFactory... factories) {
104        factoryByType = Arrays.stream(factories).collect(Collectors
105            .toMap(f -> f.componentType().getName(), Function.identity(),
106                (a, b) -> b));
107        synchronize(currentConfig);
108        return this;
109    }
110
111    /**
112     * Sets the pinned configurations. These configurations are
113     * in effect independent of any information passed by
114     * {@link ConfigurationUpdate} events.
115     *
116     * @param pinnedConfigurations the configurations to be pinned
117     * @return the component provider for easy chaining
118     */
119    @SuppressWarnings({ "rawtypes", "unchecked" })
120    public ComponentProvider
121            setPinned(Collection<Map<String, ?>> pinnedConfigurations) {
122        this.pinnedConfigurations = (Collection<
123                Map<String, String>>) (Collection) pinnedConfigurations;
124        synchronize(currentConfig);
125        return this;
126    }
127
128    /**
129     * Selects configuration information from the event. The default
130     * implementation uses the component's path for obtaining the
131     * configuration information. called by 
132     * {@link #componentConfigurations(ConfigurationUpdate)}.
133     *
134     * @param evt the event
135     * @return the configuration information as provided by
136     * {@link ConfigurationUpdate#structured(String)} if it exists
137     * 
138     */
139    protected Optional<Map<String, ?>>
140            providerConfiguration(ConfigurationUpdate evt) {
141        return evt.structured(componentPath());
142    }
143
144    /**
145     * Returns the configurations for the components to be provided.
146     * Overriding this method enables derived classes to fully 
147     * control how this information is retrieved from the
148     * {@link ConfigurationUpdate} event.
149     * 
150     * This implementation of the method calls 
151     * {@link #componentConfigurations(ConfigurationUpdate)} to obtain
152     * all configuration information targeted at this component.
153     * It then uses the configured entry 
154     * (see {@link #setComponentsEntry(String)}) to retrieve the information
155     * about the components to be provided.
156     * 
157     * The method must ensure that the result is a collection
158     * of maps, where each map has at least two entries with
159     * keys "componentType" and "name", each with an associated
160     * value of type {@link String}.
161     * 
162     * @param evt the event
163     * @return the collection
164     */
165    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidDuplicateLiterals")
166    protected Collection<Map<String, String>>
167            componentConfigurations(ConfigurationUpdate evt) {
168        return providerConfiguration(evt)
169            .map(conf -> conf.get(componentsEntry))
170            .filter(Collection.class::isInstance).map(c -> (Collection<?>) c)
171            .orElse(Collections.emptyList()).stream()
172            .filter(Map.class::isInstance).map(c -> (Map<?, ?>) c)
173            .filter(c -> c.keySet().containsAll(Set.of("componentType", "name"))
174                && String.class.isInstance(c.get("componentType"))
175                && String.class.isInstance(c.get("name")))
176            .map(c -> {
177                @SuppressWarnings("unchecked") // Checked for relevant entries
178                var casted = (Map<String, String>) c;
179                return casted;
180            })
181            .collect(Collectors.toList());
182    }
183
184    /**
185     * Uses the information from the event to configure the
186     * provided components.
187     * 
188     * @param evt the event
189     */
190    @Handler
191    public void onConfigurationUpdate(ConfigurationUpdate evt) {
192        synchronize(componentConfigurations(evt));
193    }
194
195    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidSynchronizedAtMethodLevel")
196    private synchronized void
197            synchronize(Collection<Map<String, String>> requested) {
198        // Calculate starters for to be added/to be removed
199        var toBeAdded = new LinkedList<>(requested);
200        toBeAdded.addAll(pinnedConfigurations);
201        var toBeRemoved = children().stream()
202            .map(c -> Components.manager(c))
203            .collect(Collectors.toCollection(LinkedList::new));
204
205        // Don't attempt to add something that we have no factory for.
206        toBeAdded = toBeAdded.stream()
207            .filter(c -> factoryByType.containsKey(c.get("componentType")))
208            .collect(Collectors.toCollection(LinkedList::new));
209
210        // Remove the intersection of "to be added" and "to be removed" from
211        // both, thus leaving what their names say.
212        for (var childIter = toBeRemoved.iterator();
213                childIter.hasNext();) {
214            var child = childIter.next();
215            @SuppressWarnings("PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis")
216            var childComp = child.component().getClass().getName();
217            var childName = child.name();
218            for (var confIter = toBeAdded.iterator();
219                    confIter.hasNext();) {
220                var config = confIter.next();
221                var confComp = config.get("componentType");
222                var confName = config.get("name");
223                if (confComp.equals(childComp)
224                    && Objects.equals(childName, confName)) {
225                    confIter.remove();
226                    childIter.remove();
227                }
228            }
229        }
230
231        // Update children
232        for (var child : toBeRemoved) {
233            child.detach();
234        }
235        toBeAdded.stream().map(config -> {
236            return factoryByType.get(config.get("componentType"))
237                .create(channel(), config).map(
238                    c -> ComponentFactory.setStandardProperties(c, config))
239                .stream();
240        }).flatMap(Function.identity())
241            .forEach(component -> attach(component));
242
243        // Save configuration as current
244        currentConfig = requested;
245    }
246
247}
